sub_title: Software Team Leader 3D Printing at Signify
summary:
Experienced and passionate Software Engineer having experience in industries such as Lighting, Insurance, Banking, Social Media and Automotive. Has played various roles ranging from a Developer, Lead developer, Scrum master to a Project Manager. Cheerful, energetic and motivated person blending easily into diverse teams.

Specialties: Mobile Application development (iPhone, android and windows mobile), Project management, Agile

projects.title: Newsfeed
projects.description:
Technology: C#/ASP .net framework, Windows Communication Foundation (WCF), nHibernate, DB2 database, nUnit

Project Description: 
This involved the development of a Social Media plug-in for MS Outlook called Newsfeed. This plug-in mainly enables,
•	Display of status of user and members of the contact list in MS Communicator.
•	Setting, updating the status and attachment of an URL  and synchronization of status with MS Communicator
•	Synchronization with iConf – if user is in Conference call, the same is updated in the Newsfeed.

Contribution: 
•	Identifying the key requirements and developing the Product Requirements document.
•	User Interface and Application Database design using DB2
•	Integration with Active Directory, Database and MS Communicator using WCF services

contributors.headline: Software Team Leader 3D Printing at Signify

projects.title: gupshup
projects.description:
Technology: Objective-C , iOS SDK (iPhone), Facebook iOS SDK, MGTwitterEngine, JSON

Project Description: 
GUPSHUP is a Social Media iPhone App. Using this App the user can track topics which have been initiate by him/her through a status update, tweet or photo-upload. This helps user to track only specific threads of interest. 

Contribution: 
•	UI design and development.
•	Integration with Facebook SDK and Twitter Engine
•	Feed parsing and rendering.

contributors.headline: Software Team Leader 3D Printing at Signify

projects.title: Common UI Tool
projects.description:
Technology: C#, Windows Mobile 6.0, XML

Project Description: 
Common UI tool is an application which automates the UI screen development for various multiple smart-phone mobile platforms such as Android, Blackberry, Windows mobile and J2ME. The tool takes as input, an XML file which contains the various UI control attributes such type, width, height, relative position etc. This tool offers the following advantages:
•	Uniform User Experience across the multiple target platforms.
•	Productivity gains in the Software Development process. 

Contribution: 
Worked on UI generation for Window’s Mobile platform. Main tasks included, 
•	Development of XML based parser module.
•	Code generation to render the UI control based in XML input.

contributors.headline: Software Team Leader 3D Printing at Signify

projects.title: Mobile Insurance & Fund Status Check
projects.description:
Technology: C#, Windows Mobile 6.0

Project Description: 
The Mobile Status Check is an Windows mobile application which enables an user to check
•	The Insurance policy status based on a policy number
•	The NAV of a fund, based on the policy/ folio number and fund name.
The details requested by the user are rendered on the mobile screen. These can be printed over a Blue tooth link.
This project was executed for a major domestic Insurance and Asset Management company.  

Contribution: 
•	Development of UI.
•	Development of communication module for data exchange with remote server over  HTTPS and SMS connection.
•	Development  of communication module

contributors.headline: Software Team Leader 3D Printing at Signify

projects.title: Mobile Application Management (MAM)
projects.description:
Technology: C#, Windows Mobile 6.0, SQL Server CE, XML

Project Description: 
MAM is a Wipro enterprise mobility product which remotely manages enterprise specific applications installed on Windows Mobile devices. Currently the following application management functions can be executed - installation, un-installation and upgrade. The actual functions need to be configured on the Enterprise Server by an administrator. The device polls the server to learn what functions are to be executed. The MAM application can be installed OTA (Over the Air) on the device.

Contribution: 
Developed the MAM Windows service on client which implements core functionality of the application. This involved:
•	Development of module which communicates with Enterprise Server using synchronous HTTP requests and responses.
•	Development of module which serializes and de-serializes the request and responses respectively.
•	Maintenance of on-device database which contains the management functions and their parameters.

contributors.headline: Software Team Leader 3D Printing at Signify

projects.title: Wipro Employee Tracker
projects.description:
Technology: C#/ASP.Net, SQL Server 2005

Project Description: 
This application is used to track the location of registered Blackberry users within an Enterprise. The application generates the location coordinates and transmits them to the Enterprise server on a regular basis. A web application uses these co-ordinates to track the user’s current location. Users with appropriate access rights can query this web application to obtain specific users location using an SMS. 

Contribution: 
•	Developed the web application which receives the location co-ordinates from Blackberry device. 
•	Developed the database store location co-ordinates and the mapped location name.
•	Developed the SMS handler module which handles incoming SMS messages and outgoing SMS messages.

contributors.headline: Software Team Leader 3D Printing at Signify

projects.title: Mobile Claims Adjuster
projects.description:
Technology: C#, Windows Mobile 6.0, SQL Server CE

Project Description: 
Mobile Claim Adjuster is Wipro’s proprietary product targeted to the Insurance industry.  This product  provides  a  mobile  based  solution  to  automate  the  Claims  process.  This solution enables an Insurance agent to capture the insurance claims information at the spot of the incident, for example an accident site. The claims information is then uploaded to the Insurance company’s server for further processing by a Claims Adjusting Agent. 
This solution has been validated and certified by Motorola for their devices.
Additionally, a version of Mobile Claims Adjuster was developed as a demo application for MWC (Mobile world congress) and CTIA. The UI was redeveloped for Windows mobile 6.5 devices - OMNIA (Touch based) and SCALA (Qwerty keypad).

Contribution: 
•	Gathered requirements, designed and defined Claims workflow. 
•	Developed Mobile UI, Custom controls, Image and signature capture on mobile. 
•	Development of module which communicates with Enterprise Server using HTTPS requests and responses.
•	Designed test cases in Motorola format and coordinated  with Motorola test team for App Validation and Certification

projects.title: Auto Integrator Tool
projects.description:
Technology: VC++, LEX&YACC,C

Project Description: 
The Tool is used to automate the software build process of Embedded Automotive Software. The build parameters are specified in Excel &Word format in Japanese & English languages, the tool scans this input generates the Integrated Package to be flashed. 
This was developed for a major Japanese Automobile Company

Contribution: 
•	Requirement gathering, analysis, design
•	 Development of Excel and Word parser module.
•	End to end testing of the tool

profile_positions.description:
Part of Signify Research team, working closely with Hue and Prof
businesses. I have developed various prototypes which were transferred to
R&D and released to customers.
For this, I interacted closely with various teams in business such as app team,
UX Experience team to design, develop and test the prototypes including user
testing.
● Lead developer for voice control for Interact Office (using Amazon Alexa)
● Product owner for Elderly monitoring proposition (e.g. fall detection),
being developed in co-operation with TU/e, conducted user studies with
elderly across various countries
● Designed and developed various prototypes for Hue Business
● Part of Edge-1 leadership program
● Part of 'Diversity & Inclusion' mentoring program
